@tractorman07 @agricontract @EnvAgency Take the Ancholme, 27km with 13 inches of fall. EA said its not worth dredging below Brigg as they maintain a certain water level. Would not a deeper channel draw more water from further back when they open the gates into the Humber or am I just being to simplistic?

@hslyfarms @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency The more land drains I repair this year the more I realise that fields that look saturated are more often than not just under performing on infiltration. Something I need to work harder on. Wet as hell in the top few inches and fairly dry underneath.
@moransrepairs @MrAndy_Carter @EnvAgencyNW @pow_rebecca What natural flood mitigation is in place? Trees, beavers etc?

text: @TimGue1 @powell_peter @agricontract @EnvAgency In addition, by the time your idealised river meets the sea it will be well below sea level and will have to be pumped over the sea wall in its entirety.

@Rosewood_Farm @MFRFurness @TM_WRT @agricontract @JamesAgscope @EnvAgency We have the lowest farm on the drainage system which was designed around a100 yrs ago. With current local building we now flood within hours of heavy rain. System needs modernising

@TimGue1 @powell_peter @agricontract @EnvAgency To turn a river into a water chute you would need have a sufficient and even drop along its length.  Otherwise upward pinch points - cities, ports, rocky beds, etc. will generate flooding immediately upstream. Rivers are shaped like trees, not lines, so a massive feat.

@powell_peter @agricontract @EnvAgency The River through our farm is tidal, it has less than half the capacity of 30 years ago, when the tide goes out its efficiency of getting water to the sea is severely hampered, more flooding and less soil capacity. Yes address the whole catchment. At the moment nothing is done.

urls.title: Run the Month with Prostate Cancer UK
urls.description: I'm running 26.6 miles throughout January to raise money for Prostate Cancer UK.

text:
Slowly clocking up my run a marathon 26.2 miles in January for @ProstateUK 
Our @EnvAgency team have all either had, been diagnosed with, or are currently going through treatment for prostate cancer and are now pushing over the £2000 sponsorship!
Donate at
https://t.co/YAGOFU67Ln
